thread.title: Twitter Points Out Kate Upton Isn't Even Wearing A Swimsuit On Her SI Covers
thread.title_full: Twitter Points Out Kate Upton Isn't Even Wearing A Swimsuit On Her SI Covers

author: Carly Ledbetter
title: Twitter Points Out Kate Upton Isn't Even Wearing A Swimsuit On Her SI Covers
text:
Twitter Points Out Kate Upton Isn't Even Wearing A Swimsuit On Her SI Covers Oh come on, people. 
Kate Upton just scored a three-peat. 
The 24-year-old model and actress was named Sports Illustratedâ€™s Swimsuit Edition cover girl for the third time and earned herself three different covers for the 2017 issue. The 2017 SI Swimsuit Covers have been revealed. Welcome back, @KateUpton ! Follow the link for more photos and video https://t.co/4cszjybbVp pic.twitter.com/y7TguJdPVD â€” SI Swimsuit (@SI_Swimsuit) February 15, 2017 
Though Upton looks gorgeous on the covers, people couldnâ€™t get over one tiny little problem with them â€• that she isnâ€™t actually wearing a true swimsuit on any of them. Happy that Kate Upton is the SI Swimsuit cover model but it's funny that of 3 cover photos, not one is an actual swimsuit you could wear. â€” Tiffany Schilling (@tiffffanyd) February 15, 2017 @KateUpton @SI_Swimsuit congrats! But 3 covers of a "swimsuit issue" and only one half of a swimsuit in total, got me ğŸ˜‚ ğŸ˜‚ ğŸ˜‚ ğŸ˜‚ ğŸ˜‚ â€” Alex Struckmeyer (@struckalex) February 15, 2017 I love that Kate upton is on 3 SI covers and on all 3 combined she's wearing half a swimsuit 
Elle Magazine pointed it out in the headline of their Upton article : Kate Upton is pretty much naked on three different Sport's Illustrated Swimsuit Issue covers, no swimsuit in sight: https://t.co/4dT0mGwcyT ? pic.twitter.com/vov8PR4SdW â€” ELLE Magazine (US) (@ELLEmagazine) February 15, 2017 
And CNNâ€™s Jake Tapper even chimed in for some unknown reason: @KateUpton those bathing suits look impractical â€” Jake Tapper (@jaketapper) February 15, 2017 
Perez Hilton mightâ€™ve said it best when he broke down her â€œswimsuitsâ€ cover by cover: 
â€œOne cover (above) has her topless with her bottom half clad in a bunch of necklaces, basically,â€ he wrote. â€œA second cover features her in a bunch of string made to resemble a maillot, while a third one finally has her in honest-to-God bikini bottoms and a long-sleeved embellished top.â€ 
As we all know, the Swimsuit Edition hasnâ€™t ever really been about the swimsuits at all. If weâ€™re all getting really nit-picky, thereâ€™s usually a body paint section in the magazine, so those donâ€™t even begin to count as bathing suits. 
If people are going to take issue with anything in the Swimsuit Edition, letâ€™s figure out why Serena Williams or 63-year-old Christie Brinkley didnâ€™t land the cover. Especially since Upton herself said this issueâ€™s theme was about â€œevery woman of every age and every body type being accepted. It was inspiring to be asked to be a part of that issue.â€
